message.content:
cs.CR, cs.SD, cs.SY, cs.IT, cs.HC

The paper discusses a covert communication method between air-gapped computers using ultrasonic waves transmitted through speakers and headphones. This falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR) as it involves a malware exploiting a specific audio chip feature. The paper also involves signal processing (cs.SD) as it evaluates the communication channel with different equipment and transmission speeds. The paper also discusses practical considerations for the communication method, which falls under the category of systems and control (cs.SY). Information theory (cs.IT) is also relevant as the paper discusses the transmission of data through the communication channel. Finally, the paper discusses the use of headphones for covert communication, which falls under the category of human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
